quotes over three full lines should be block quotes (sidenote: I've never seen a long quote such as this used as an opening sentence in a Wikipedia article)
Not a bad quote - let it run

references always go at the ends of sentences, not in the middle
reference should be with what it is supporting, that is collectivisim.
authoritarianism and totalitarianism = opposition to democracy = redundant
No mention of capitalism in source.
references go at end of sentence
moved some material from intro; this should be a section on the Third Way approach
we must avoid giving undue weight to one particular aspect of fascism
Preserve recent additions, but rewrite slightly for clarity -- this is getting better, actually
/* Economic planning */ arising after the great depression
/* Economic planning */ still requesting a source. Citing a wikipedia article is not a permissible source.
/* Economic planning */ You're citing a Wikipedia article?
/* Economic planning */ added footnote leading to relevant Wikipedia articles
/* Economic planning */ i request a source for this
/* Economic planning */ deleted "today" because economic planning is an ancient concept & deleted grammatically incorrect & redundant phrase
/* Economic planning */ example from the source
/* Economic planning */ added "today" economic planning was a new thing
/* Economic planning */ added factual and relevant clarification
/* Authoritarian and totalitarian state */ improved wording of sentence for accuracy and better flow
/* Economic planning */ no source was ever given for this so removing
/* Economic regulation */ changed to "economic planning" it's not mere regulation.
created new Legacy section and added some material
/* Authoritarian and totalitarian state */ Added FDR to New Deal sentence.
pruned "or capitalism in general" from end of sentence. "private ownership of industry" has it covered.
various formatting & wording improvements in first section
dont forget the italian fascists which the source says as well opposed laissez-faire
Not in source that they considered what they supported to be "industrial capitalism"
third way linked to [[Third Way (centrism)]] , not exactly what we're talking about
corporatism is already mentioned in the intro
rewording capitalism part (no need for specific example in the intro)
source says Italian Fascists as well
"laissez-faire capitalism & finance capitalism & Jews, etc." : "laissez-faire capitalism" period. (this is an intro, and "finance capitalism" is part of "capitalism")
rv to precedent consensual version (removing controversial to talk)
moving controversial statement in intro to talk
[[WP:AES|â]]Undid revision 116346760 by [[Special:Contributions/Billy Ego|Billy Ego]] ([[User talk:Billy Ego|talk]])
rv - last edit seemed to confuse rather than clarify the intro
Racism not an essential element of fascism
"especially" national socialists is not in the sources. Rewording sentence, since it looked like it said Nazis invented the term "finance capitalism".
The two concepts are not mutually exclusive - a right-wing revolt of the center or middle class
rv. anti-socialism was not an "integral part" of fascism. This should not be in the same group as corporatism, anti-communism,etc. anti-communism already implies anti-Marxian socialism
rv, that's nonsense, many fascist movements, esp. the NSDAP persecuted socialists
Fascism can't be generally described as "anti-socialist" so I removed it. Many fascist movements, like the Nazis, had heavy strains of socialism in their platforms.
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Billy Ego|Billy Ego]] ([[User talk:Billy Ego|talk]]) to last version by Jfrascencio
How can you call state directed means of production capitalism? Look up capitalism will you?
Not correct, the state does not control the means of production actually, but regulates those who do.
/* Economic regulation */ Source does not say this
This is what the source says.
"some" is a weasal word. Like in some say this, and some say that. Some say that the Earth is flat also. Who could dispute that.
laissez-faire capitalism -> the economy. When laissez-faire capitalism is regulated, it is no longer laissez-faire.
rv: POV, removal of well cited and uncontested information, undue weight to Hitler's propaganda.
/* State-planned economy */ however Hitler said he was a socialist
/* Economic regulation */ changed title to state planned economy
the state is just a means to benefit the collective
not regulation of laissez-faire, but no laissez-faire. It is a state run economy.
/* Economic regulation */ if you're going to misrepresent what a source says then don't say anything
/* Economic regulation */ "destroy capitalism under all conditions"
A lie is being told about what the source says.
"regulation of laissez-faire capitalism" implies that it's still laissez-faire capitalism. It is not, and it is not simply "regulation." It an extensive state control.
/* Economic regulation */ Source doesn't say this.
rv self - didnt see talk page discussion
calvin source says: "nevertheless the essence of both national socialism and Italian fascism is opposed to laissez faire."
This is what the source is actually stating.
rv to billy ego. do not remove things that are sourced.
Sources do not clearly support this and may just be reinforcing that there was a coexistance between fascism and laissez faire.
rm all but two Mussolini wlinks

others say it is an extremism of the center
